oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Len Blaylock oral history
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Blaylock, Len
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An oral history interview with Len Blaylock, who was an officer in the 11th College Training Detachment (CTD) stationed at Middle Tennessee State College during World War II. He discusses how the CTD's presence affected campus life as well as life on the World War II homefront
Left to right: 1st Lt. Lawrence T. Pattock, 1st Lt. Philip T. Rivers, 1st Lt. Eugene Blasdel (C.O.), and 2nd Lt. Len. E. Blaylock.
1. College Training Detachment cadet life on campus --2. College Training Detachment victory gardens
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Student Life; Campus life; Great Depression; World War II

Victory gardens; Civilian Conservation Corps (U.S.); Depressions--1929; World War, 1939-1945; Korean War, 1950-1953; United States. Army Air Forces. College Training Detachment, 11th; Middle Tennessee State Teachers College
